intro: Xylobium ecuadorense, commonly known as the Ecuadorian xylobium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of the genus Xylobium. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
